data.text:
Provo, UT, USA

Latitude and longitude coordinates are: 40.233845, -111.658531.

Provo is the seat of Utah County, a wonderful cultural center, and one of the largest cities in the state of Utah, the United States. Located 44 miles south of Salt Lake City, in the north-central part of the state, it is home to several international companies such as Morinda Bioactives, Aquaveo, Qualtrics, Vivint, etc. Brigham Young University and Utah Valley Regional Medical Center are also based in the city and the top employers of Provo. The Provo Municipal Airport serves the city. It is also one of the busiest airports in the state. Interstate 15 and Amtrak provide access to Provo, as well.

Provo is a historical city of arts and enlightening, with old universities and libraries. The most known local attractions include Covey Center for the Arts, Lakeside Storage and Museum, BYU Museum of Paleontology, Crandall Historical Printing Museum, The Provo Utah Temple, Provo City Center Temple, The Utah Valley Convention Center, The Provo City Library, Bridal Veil Falls, The Provo River, Brigham Young University Arboretum, Reed O. Smoot House, LaVell Edwards Stadium, Timpanogos Cave National Monument, Provo Peak, Peaks Ice Arena, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, and Utah Lake.
